different options no shaping and hourglass shaping no shaping knit in stockinette until jumper measures 12 5 12 75 13 13 25 13 5 13 75 14 14 25 14 5 14 75 15 15 25 14 5 15 25 15 5 16 16 25 16 75 17 17 5 17 75 18 / 36 5 37 37 5 38 39 39 5 40 40 5 41 5 42 42 5 43 41 5 43 44 45 45 5 47 47 5 49 49 5 50 cm from underarm co or 2 /5cm from desired length switch to smaller needles rib setup *kl p1 repeat from * around rib stitch *k1bl p1 repeat from * around work rib stitch for approximately 2 /5cm bobble loosely break yarn weave in ends proceed to sleeves hourglass shaping women s sizes only these instructions create a simple hourglass shape that is 3 25 /8 5cm smaller in the waist than in the chest/hips this shape is only a guideline your best option is to work your own shaping based on your unique body and preferences once your dart markers are in place it s easy to increase and decrease wherever you feel like it trying on your work to check as you go you can even add more room in the front than the back or vice versa remember top-down = no rules stockinette knit 17 19 21 23 25 27 29 31 33 35 37 39 rounds or until desired point before shaping setup round all steps below are worked within a single round knit 15 17 18 20 21 23 24 25 26 28 28 30 pm knit 54 58 65 68 74 79 83 87 91 95 100 105 pm knit 46 49 54 59 62 67 70 75 78 81 84 89 pm knit 54 58 65 68 74 79 83 87 91 95 100 105 pm knit 15 16 18 19 21 22 24 24 26 27 28 29 you are back to the bor 10 plumose laura barkla decrease section the following instructions apply to the new markers only do not decrease at the bor marker decrease round *knit to 2 stitches before marker k2t sm knit to marker sm ssk repeat from * once knit to end of round knit 6 rounds work the above 2 steps a total of 5 times stitch count 164 178 200 214 232 250 264 278 292 306 320 338 middle section knit 4 rounds increase section the following instructions apply to the new markers only do not increase at the bor marker knit 6 rounds total of 16
